trails.description: A popular moderate hike that leads to a pretty 20-foot waterfall. Located in Cades Cove.
This loop trail through an old growth forest is located off of the Maddron Bald Trail. Use the Maddron Bald trailhead to access.
This very popular hike takes you up to Alum Cave which isn't really a cave, but a rock overhang. One can continue on up to Mt. Leconte from this trail.

trails.hikeName: Forney Ridge Trail to Andrews Bald
trails.description: This a relatively short, though moderate hike to Andrews Bald. Access from the Clingmons Dome parking area. This is a crowded area, but the moderate difficulty of the hike means less crowds on this trail.

Park at the Jakes Creek Trailhead in the ELkmont area of the park. This is a relatively short hike to an old historical cabin structure. The Elkmont area was a popular vacation resort prior to the area becoming a national park.
A strenuous hike that follows the Benton MacKaye Trail as it climbs up Balsam Mountain. There are no views at the top, so do this hike for the exercise and the solitude.

A hike close to Gatlinburg where you can view waterfall, take a short side trip to a cemetery, and see some views of nearby ridges and Gatlinburg. Tip: park on Cherokee Orchard Road before the beginning of the one-way Roaring Fork Motor trail. Take a short walk up the road to find the trailhead. When you leave you can make a return trip on Cherokee Orchard Road and avoid the typical slow, heavy traffic Roaring Fork Motor Trail
